question: What does it mean for a political party to "be in power"?
possible_answers: A. To gain the approval of the Queen or King
B. To have the most elected representatives
D. To hold the nuclear button
main_question: What does it mean for a political party to "be in power"?
answer: B. To have the most elected representatives
explanatory_sentence: After an election, the leader of the political party with the most seats in the House of Commons is invited by the Governor General to form the government.
